isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Removal and Disassembly - Remove Brake Assembly and Spindle from Knuckle

svcproc.title: Remove Brake Assembly and Spindle from Knuckle

step1.para: To disassemble the brake assembly and spindle from the steering knuckle, remove the attaching capscrews (Figure 19).
On units equipped for ABS, push the ABS sensor into the knuckle cavity (Figure 20).

figure.caption: Figure 20. Push ABS Sensor into Knuckle Cavity

step1.para: Pull the brake assembly off the spindle. Take care to prevent the spindle from falling.

On units equipped for ABS, the steel sleeve and sensor clip for positioning the ABS sensor will remain on the spindle. If necessary, push out the sensor clip. Remove the sleeve with a suitable driver.

note.para: The stop screw maintains the vehicle manufacturer's maximum turning angle. The stop screw does not need to be removed. If removing the stop screw, mark the installed depth for reassembly.

step1.para: Pull the spindle straight from the knuckle and axle shaft (Figure 21).

figure.caption: Figure 21. Pull Spindle Straight From Knuckle and Axle Shaft

step1.para: The axle shaft bushing and oil seal will remain inside the spindle. If necessary, remove these parts with the appropriate tool.

note.para: The axle shaft double cardan joint can be pulled through the steering knuckle opening. If you are only removing the axle shaft without the knuckle, go to Remove Axle Shaft Without Removing Steering Knuckle.
